alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 9:32PM PST until January 18 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Some farm buildings may be threatened and roads covered in low areas by rising water. Expect widespread flooding throughout the Coquille River floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM PST Monday the stage was 23.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM PST Monday was 23.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 23.2 feet late this evening. It will fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.2 feet on 12/24/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Coquille River Coquille 21.0 23.1 Mon 8 pm PST 21.8 21.2 19.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/mfr/ The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 945 AM PST.
